uid.description: The unique Firebase Auth ID for the user.

displayName_lowercase.description: Lowercase version of the display name for case-insensitive searches.

definition.description: Stores public user profile information. Each document is keyed by the user's Firebase Auth ID.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique ID of the user.

structure.rules: allow read, write: if request.auth != null && request.auth.uid == userId;

firestore.reasoning: A fresh backend definition to solve persistent permission errors. This rule ensures that a user can only read or write to their own document in the 'users' collection, which is a secure and standard practice for managing user profiles. All other collections and rules have been removed to ensure a clean state.
